details.flavorText:
Dalos are reclusive fey that dwell within or near remote volcanoes and volcanic vents and resemble the massive calderas they call home. They more often dwell within the superheated confines of these locales than in the "cold wastelands" beyond their warmth and are therefore rarely encountered outside such environments. Like most fey, dalos are capricious and vengeful. They hate being disturbed above all else and will often warn away intruders with only the throw of a red-hot boulder before attacking outright.

A dalos stands 25 feet tall and weighs in excess of 20,000 pounds.
details.sidebarText:
Dalos Allies

.Because of their reclusiveness, dalos are unlikely to be encountered in the company of other creatures, though on occasion they may serve as begrudging guardians for powerful magma dragons or tribes of fire giants.

source.value: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City

description.label: Description
description.value:
Using the weight of earth, you hamper a target's flight, with effects based on its Fortitude save. If the creature reaches the ground safely, it doesn't take falling damage.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target falls safely up to 120 feet.

Failure The target falls safely up to 120 feet. If it hits the ground, it can't Fly, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target falls safely up to 120 feet. If it hits the ground, it can't Fly, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground for 1 minute.

description.label: Description
description.value:

description.label: Description
description.value:
You dilate the flow of time around the target, slowing its actions.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed} 1 for 1 round.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed} 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed} 2 for 1 minute.

Heightened You can target up to 10 creatures.

description.label: Description
description.value:
You create a cloud of putrid mist in the area. The cloud functions as obscuring mist except it sickens creatures that end their turns within the cloud.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened} 1.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened} 1 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed} 1 while in the cloud.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened} 2 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed} 1 until it leaves the cloud.
10 feet, [[/r 3d6 # fire damage]] fire damage (DC 29 basic Reflex save).

Whenever the dalos takes damage from a melee Strike, magma splashes from its open wound and sticks to nearby creatures. Each creature in a 10-foot emanation must attempt a DC 31 Reflex save. On a failure, the creature takes [[/r 3d6 # persistent fire damage]] persistent fire damage as the superheated rock sticks to them and cools. The DC to end this persistent damage decreases by 5 each turn after the first as the magma cools.
The dalos blasts smoke from its head, creating a 20-foot-radius cloud of smoke that drifts to a location within 120 feet. This has the effects of obscuring mist.

The dalos uses an Interact action to pluck a rock from its body or the nearby environment, then uses its internal fires to heat a rock it's holding until the rock is red hot. A heated rock that hits a target on a ranged Strike deals an additional [[/r 4d6 # fire damage]] fire damage. Once the dalos heats a rock, that rock retains its heat for 2 rounds before cooling.

The dalos causes a volcanic explosion to erupt from its head, lobbing a mass of molten rock up to 100 feet. This lava bomb deals [[/r 6d8 # fire damage]] fire damage and [[/r 6d8 # bludgeoning damage]] bludgeoning damage to each creature in a 20-foot radius of its impact point, with a DC 33 basic Reflex save. The dalos can't use Lava Bomb again for 1d4 rounds.
The monster picks up a rock within reach or retrieves a stowed rock and throws it, making a ranged Strike.
